issue.title: sqlsrv does not support resetting sequence

labels.name: status:ready for adoption
labels.description: Feel free to implement this issue.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Run db->createCommand()->resetSequence()

### What is the expected result?

MSSQL QueryBuilder runs something like:

```sql
ALTER SEQUENCE foo.fee
RESTART
```

### What do you get instead?

```
Exception 'yii\base\NotSupportedException' with message 'sqlsrv does not support resetting sequence.'

in /var/www/html/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/QueryBuilder.php:602
```

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.11.2
| PHP version      | 7.0.13
| Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04

body: MSSQL (SQL Server) and MySQL reset the sequence by default when using truncate table. PGSql has an option to do so, that is currently not implemented in Yii2. This is in fact inconsistent, and should be added as well.

issue.title: `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable` should work consistent over all databases

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Cubrid, MSSQL, MySQL, and OCI already restart the identity by default, PGSQL doesn't. This PR makes the use of the `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable` method more consistent.

_Note: RESTART IDENTITY is available from PGSQL 8.4+_

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | yes
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13577

issue.title: `yii\test\ActiveFixture::resetTable()` should use `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable()` instead of manual delete/reset

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Because `yii\db\QueryBuilder::resetSequence()` is not implemented for all drivers, using `yii\db\QueryBuilder::truncateTable()` will yield better results over all drivers. For example, it enables the use of ActiveFixture for MSSQL, where it couldn't be used before.

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13577

issue.title: Implemented `yii\db\mssql\QueryBuilder::resetSequence()`

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Mentioned in #13577 and #13581 and compatible with SQL Server 2008+.

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13577

body: After some research, I've found that TRUNCATE TABLE does not work with VIEWS, while the current implementation does. To make it all work for MSSQL we should focus on implementing resetSequence() for that driver, as seen here: #13582
